comments:
When I try to open task imported from JIRA repository I get an Mylar-Error dialog with information that:

Could not create editor via factory: org.eclipse.mylar.internal.jira.core.ui.editor.JiraTaskEditorFactory@1fe2c10
Argument not valid.

After clicking OK, editor opens with Planning and Browser tab at the bottom (should there be one more tab?).

The reasoning here was that if we don't have two to compare, we just don't know what has changed.

Yes, but isn't if one is null and other is not mean that you actually have a change? Current code is saying there is no change if current is null, but if new is not null, then it is a change, isn't it?

Okay I see your point Eugene. If an attribute is now found on the new data that didn't exist on the old than this should be a 'change'. I've updated the code to reflect this and fixed the npe. I'll mark as fixed and we can re-open if you are still unable to open the editor after (tonights?) rc2 build.
